title: MindWheel
author: Inspired by Robert Pinsky's Classic
intro:
The year is 2036. Earth's civilization teeters on the brink of collapse.

Dr. Virgil Sinclair has summoned you to his laboratory. He has discovered
the MindWheel - a device that allows consciousness to enter the mental
landscapes of four great thinkers, now preserved in digital form.

Somewhere within these minds lies the key to humanity's salvation:
four sacred objects that, when combined, can restore balance to the world.

You must journey through:
- The mind of a POET, where language shapes reality
- The mind of a SCIENTIST, where logic rules all
- The mind of a GENERAL, where strategy and conflict reign
- The mind of a PROPHET, where visions of future and past collide

Find the four sacred objects. Save humanity. But be warned:
These minds are not safe places. Madness lurks in brilliance.

Are you ready to enter the MindWheel?

rooms.name: Dr. Sinclair's Laboratory - 2036
rooms.description:
A cluttered lab filled with computers, neural scanners, and mysterious
equipment. Dr. Sinclair stands beside the MindWheel apparatus - a
crystalline sphere pulsing with inner light.

Four pedestals surround the sphere, each labeled: POET, SCIENTIST,
GENERAL, PROPHET. Place your hand on a pedestal to enter that mind.

A STATUS MONITOR shows your collected objects.

rooms.name: The Poet's Garden of Words
rooms.description:
You stand in a garden where language has physical form. Sentences
wind through the air like vines. Metaphors bloom as flowers. The very
ground beneath your feet is composed of compressed poetry.

The sky above shifts colors with each spoken word. To the east lies
a Library of Unwritten Books. West leads to the Sea of Syllables.
North is the Tower of Verse.

rooms.name: The Tower of Verse
rooms.description:
A spiraling tower built entirely from stanzas. Each level represents
a different poetic form: sonnets, haiku, free verse, epic poetry.
The stairs are made of rhythm and rhyme.

At the top, you see a gleaming object catching the metaphorical light.
The garden lies south.

rooms.name: Library of Unwritten Books
rooms.description:
Endless shelves stretch into infinity, filled with books that were
never written - stories that died with their authors, poems lost to time.
Ghost readers drift between the stacks, searching for what might have been.

A GUARDIAN made of blank pages watches over this place. The garden is west.

rooms.name: Sea of Syllables
rooms.description:
An ocean where waves are composed of spoken sounds. Phonemes drift
like foam. You can hear the rhythm of breathing, the percussion of
consonants, the melody of vowels.

A small boat made of parentheses rocks gently at a dock. The garden is east.

rooms.name: Peak of the Tower
rooms.description:
The highest point in the Poet's mind. From here you can see the entire
linguistic landscape - every word ever spoken spreads below like a
glittering tapestry.

On a pedestal of perfect meter rests THE GOLDEN LYRE.
Stairs descend to the south.

rooms.name: Island of Silence
rooms.description:
A strange island where no sound exists. Pure meaning without words.
Communication happens through thought alone. In the center stands
a monument to everything that cannot be expressed.

You can sail back west.

rooms.name: The Scientist's Cathedral of Logic
rooms.description:
A vast hall of pure rationality. Mathematical equations float in the
air like stained glass. The walls are periodic tables. The floor is
a geometric proof.

North leads to the Laboratory of Experiments. East to the Observation
Deck. West to the Archive of Theorems. South exits this mind.

rooms.name: Laboratory of Experiments
rooms.description:
Beakers bubble with chemical reactions that follow perfect laws.
Every experiment succeeds because failure has been logically eliminated.
Causality is visible as glowing threads connecting all phenomena.

A ROBOT ASSISTANT manages the equipment. The cathedral is south.

rooms.name: Observation Deck
rooms.description:
A transparent platform floating in space. Below, you observe the
universe as the Scientist sees it: pure mathematics, elegant equations,
beauty in natural law.

Stars are actually data points. Galaxies are probability distributions.
The cathedral is west.

rooms.name: Archive of Theorems
rooms.description:
Filing cabinets stretch forever, each drawer containing a proven
theorem. Axioms hang on the walls like sacred texts. This is the
temple of pure knowledge.

A puzzle blocks further access - THE LOGICAL LOCK. The cathedral is east.

rooms.name: Inner Sanctum of Reason
rooms.description:
The core of scientific thought. Everything here reduces to fundamental
principles. Complexity becomes simplicity. Chaos reveals its hidden order.

On an altar of empiricism rests THE CRYSTAL PRISM.
The laboratory is accessible to the west.

rooms.name: The General's War Room of Strategy
rooms.description:
A command center where conflict is eternal. Maps cover every surface,
showing battles past, present, and hypothetical. Toy soldiers move
themselves across terrain, reenacting history.

North is the Armory. East leads to the Battlefield Memorial. West to
the Hall of Tactics. South exits this mind.

rooms.name: The Armory of History
rooms.description:
Weapons from every era hang on the walls: swords, muskets, missiles.
Each tells a story of human conflict. The General's mind catalogs
every battle, every strategy, every victory and defeat.

A SPECTRAL SOLDIER stands guard. The war room is south.

rooms.name: Battlefield Memorial
rooms.description:
A somber field of markers, each representing a fallen soldier from
some war, real or imagined. The ground is stained with memory.
Ghost armies drill in formation nearby.

The weight of sacrifice is palpable here. The war room is west.

rooms.name: Hall of Tactics
rooms.description:
Holographic displays show famous battles: Thermopylae, Waterloo,
Gettysburg, Normandy. Each can be replayed, analyzed, improved.
The General's genius lies in seeing patterns in chaos.

A STRATEGIC CHALLENGE awaits. The war room is east.

rooms.name: Chamber of Victory
rooms.description:
A room filled with trophies and standards captured in battle. But
also something else: understanding. The General learned that true
victory isn't in conquest, but in preventing war.

On a stand of beaten swords rests THE BRONZE SHIELD.
The hall is west.

rooms.name: The Prophet's Nexus of Time
rooms.description:
Past, present, and future exist simultaneously here. You see your own
birth and death in the same moment. History spirals around you like
a double helix of causality.

North leads to the Hall of Visions. East to the Oracle's Chamber.
West to the Ruins of Tomorrow. South exits this mind.

rooms.name: Hall of Visions
rooms.description:
Prophecies manifest as living images. Some have come true, others
never will. The Prophet sees all possible futures branching like
a tree of infinite possibility.

A SEER wrapped in temporal energy meditates here. The nexus is south.

rooms.name: Oracle's Chamber
rooms.description:
A circular room with mirrors showing different timelines. In one,
humanity thrives. In another, it falls. In most, the outcome hangs
in balance, waiting for choices yet unmade.

The nexus is west.

rooms.name: Ruins of Tomorrow
rooms.description:
A devastated cityscape that might be Earth's future. Buildings crumble
under the weight of unfulfilled potential. This is what happens if
you fail your mission.

But among the ruins, hope persists. The nexus is east.

rooms.name: Temple of Renewal
rooms.description:
Hidden beneath the ruins, a temple dedicated to rebirth and second
chances. The Prophet understood: endings are also beginnings.

On an altar of eternal flame rests THE SILVER CHALICE.
The ruins are accessible to the north.

rooms.name: The MindWheel's Core
rooms.description:
You have collected all four sacred objects. As you hold them together,
they resonate with power:

- The GOLDEN LYRE (art and beauty)
- The CRYSTAL PRISM (knowledge and truth)  
- The BRONZE SHIELD (strength and protection)
- The SILVER CHALICE (hope and renewal)

These four elements - creativity, wisdom, courage, and faith - are
what humanity needs to survive. The MindWheel pulses with energy,
ready to transmit this understanding to all of Earth.

Dr. Sinclair's voice echoes: 'You have done it! The synthesis is complete!
Humanity will endure!'

items.name: golden lyre
items.description: A magnificent lyre that plays the music of pure creativity. Found in the Poet's mind, it represents art, beauty, and the power of expression.

items.name: crystal prism
items.description: A flawless prism that refracts truth into its component parts. Found in the Scientist's mind, it represents knowledge, logic, and understanding.

items.name: bronze shield
items.description: A shield marked with the scars of countless battles. Found in the General's mind, it represents strength, protection, and courage.

items.name: silver chalice
items.description: A chalice that never empties, always filled with possibility. Found in the Prophet's mind, it represents hope, renewal, and faith.

items.name: book of unwritten poems
items.description: A book whose pages fill with new poetry each time you open it. The poems are beautiful but ephemeral.

items.name: metaphor seed
items.description: A seed that, when planted in soil, grows into a living metaphor. Handle with care.

items.name: equation crystal
items.description: A crystal containing a perfect mathematical proof. It glows with the satisfaction of QED.

items.name: beaker of causality
items.description: A beaker containing the essence of cause and effect. Mix carefully.

items.name: ancient battle standard
items.description: A tattered flag from some long-forgotten war. The General's memories cling to it.

items.name: tactical map
items.description: A map that shows not just terrain, but strategic possibilities. Napoleon would have wept to own it.

items.name: temporal compass
items.description: A compass that points not to north, but to significant moments in time.

items.name: prophecy scroll
items.description: A scroll containing a prophecy. Whether it's yours is unclear.

items.name: mindwheel interface
items.description: A neural interface device. Dr. Sinclair's technology allows you to travel between minds.

monsters.name: Dr. Virgil Sinclair
monsters.description: A brilliant but eccentric scientist. He created the MindWheel and recruited you for this vital mission.

monsters.name: Guardian of Pages
monsters.description: A being made of blank paper and possibility. It protects the unwritten works from those who would destroy potential.

monsters.name: Muse of Inspiration
monsters.description: A radiant being that embodies creative inspiration. Speaking with it fills you with ideas.

monsters.name: Logic Automaton
monsters.description: A perfectly rational robot. It can only be convinced through sound reasoning and empirical evidence.

monsters.name: Paradox Entity
monsters.description: A being that exists and doesn't exist simultaneously. The Scientist's mind struggles to compute it.

monsters.name: Spectral Soldier
monsters.description: The ghost of a warrior who served the General in life. Bound by duty even in death.

monsters.name: War Strategist
monsters.description: An aspect of the General's tactical genius given form. It can solve any military puzzle.

monsters.name: Temporal Seer
monsters.description: A being unstuck in time, experiencing all moments at once. Its advice is cryptic but valuable.

monsters.name: Oracle of Possibilities
monsters.description: A prophet who sees all potential futures. Ask carefully - some knowledge is dangerous.

dialogues.greeting: Welcome! The MindWheel is ready. Four minds await exploration. Each holds a sacred object vital to humanity's survival.

topics.response: Enter the minds of the Poet, Scientist, General, and Prophet. Find the four sacred objects. When combined, they will restore balance to our dying world.
My greatest creation - a device for exploring preserved consciousness. These four minds were the greatest of their generation. Now they can save us all.
Yes, there is danger. These are powerful minds, and not all friendly. You may face guardians, puzzles, even madness. But humanity's future depends on your success.

dialogues.greeting: Who dares enter the library of what-might-have-been?

topics.response: These are works that died unwritten. Every book an author dreamed of but never penned. Every story lost to time, silence, or fear. I protect their potential.
The Golden Lyre? It rests atop the Tower of Verse. But beware - to reach it, you must climb stairs made of rhythm and rhyme. One misstep in meter, and you fall.

dialogues.greeting: Ah, a seeker of beauty! Let me inspire you with visions of art and poetry.

topics.response: Inspiration is everywhere in this mind. Every word has weight, every silence has meaning. The Poet understood: language creates reality.
I can offer you a metaphor seed. Plant it wisely, and it may help you understand this place better.

dialogues.greeting: Greetings. I am a rational entity. State your purpose in logical terms.

topics.response: The Crystal Prism is stored in the Inner Sanctum. Access requires solving the Logical Lock. I can help if you demonstrate sufficient reasoning ability.
Logic is the foundation of truth. A implies B. B implies C. Therefore A implies C. Simple. Elegant. Perfect.

dialogues.greeting: I am and I am not. I exist in superposition. Your mind cannot fully comprehend me.

topics.response: This statement is false. Did I just speak truth or lie? Your wetware cannot process the recursion. The Scientist's mind recoils from my existence.

dialogues.greeting: Halt! State your business in the General's domain.

topics.response: The Bronze Shield is in the Chamber of Victory. But to reach it, you must complete the Strategic Challenge. Prove your tactical worth.
I have fought in ten thousand battles. Every strategy, every formation, every feint and charge - I know them all. War is eternal here.

dialogues.greeting: A visitor to the tactical hall. Do you have the mind for strategy?

topics.response: The Strategic Challenge tests your ability to think like the General. It's not about brute force, but elegant solutions. Win without fighting, if you can.
True victory isn't destroying your enemy - it's making conflict unnecessary. The General learned this late in life. The shield represents that wisdom.

dialogues.greeting: I have seen your arrival. I will see your departure. All moments are now.

topics.response: I see many futures. In some, you succeed. In others, you fail. The timeline branches with every choice. Choose wisely.
The Silver Chalice hides in the Temple of Renewal, beneath the Ruins of Tomorrow. Ironic, isn't it? Hope buried under despair.

dialogues.greeting: Welcome, seeker. I can show you what may come to pass.

topics.response: I prophesy this: if you gather all four sacred objects, humanity will endure. If you fail, civilization falls within a generation.
Hope is not certainty, but possibility. The chalice represents this truth. As long as we have hope, we have a future.

quests.name: Retrieve the Golden Lyre
quests.description: Enter the Poet's mind and find the Golden Lyre, symbol of creativity and beauty.

quests.name: Retrieve the Crystal Prism
quests.description: Enter the Scientist's mind and find the Crystal Prism, symbol of knowledge and truth.

quests.name: Retrieve the Bronze Shield
quests.description: Enter the General's mind and find the Bronze Shield, symbol of strength and courage.

quests.name: Retrieve the Silver Chalice
quests.description: Enter the Prophet's mind and find the Silver Chalice, symbol of hope and renewal.

quests.name: Unite the Sacred Objects
quests.description: Bring all four sacred objects together to save humanity.

puzzles.description: To climb the Tower of Verse, you must recite poetry in perfect meter. The rhythm must be exact.
puzzles.success_message: Your words flow in perfect iambic pentameter! The tower accepts you and allows passage upward.
puzzles.failure_message: Your meter falters. The stairs beneath your feet dissolve into scattered syllables.

puzzles.description: The Logical Lock requires you to solve a complex proof. Three axioms must be combined in the correct order.
puzzles.success_message: QED! The lock recognizes your logical prowess and opens, revealing the path to the Inner Sanctum.
puzzles.failure_message: Your reasoning is flawed. The lock remains sealed. Try again with better logic.

puzzles.description: The Strategic Challenge: a holographic battle simulation. You must win without losing a single soldier.
puzzles.success_message: Brilliant! You achieved victory through strategy, not sacrifice. The General would be proud. The path opens.
puzzles.failure_message: Your tactics resulted in casualties. The General's mind rejects wasteful commanders. Try a different approach.

puzzles.description: Among the Ruins of Tomorrow, hope is hidden. You must search carefully to find the Temple of Renewal.
puzzles.success_message: You discover a hidden stairway beneath the rubble. Hope persists even in devastation. You find the temple.
puzzles.failure_message: You see only destruction. Perhaps hope requires looking deeper than surface despair.

notes: Inspired by Robert Pinsky's 'MindWheel' (1984), published by Synapse/Broderbund
The original featured poetic prose and surreal imagery
Four distinct mental landscapes, each with unique atmosphere and challenges
Sacred objects represent four pillars of civilization: Art, Knowledge, Courage, Hope
The game explores themes of consciousness, creativity, and human potential
Each mind should feel distinct: Poet=linguistic/artistic, Scientist=logical/mathematical,
Victory requires collecting all four objects, representing synthesis of human excellence
Robert Pinsky later became U.S. Poet Laureate (1997-2000)
The game was groundbreaking for its literary ambition and poetic writing
